snippet: A route to Norway through Russia has made a remote far-north border an increasingly popular back door into Europe. A legal quirk makes pedaling necessary.
abstract: Relatively small, but significant, number of migrants fleeing crisis in Africa and Middle East are choosing northern route to better life by traveling through Russia and biking into Norway; refugees note that it is cheaper and safer than crossing by water, but long and cold path to crossing north of Arctic Circle.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A route to Norway through Russia has made a remote far-north border an increasingly popular back door into Europe. A legal quirk makes pedaling necessary.

headline.print_headline: Why Are Migrants in the Arctic, on Bikes? Path Leads to Europe
headline.main: Avoiding Risky Seas, Migrants Reach Europe With an Arctic Bike Ride
